Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorNoProvider
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape was attempted but no providers have been linked

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorInvalidProvider
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape was attempted with a provider that is not supported

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorNoCredentials
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape was attempted but no valid credentials were found on disk for the specified provider

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorCantObtainToken
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape was attempted for an OAuth provider but a new access token could not be obtained

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorInvalidCredentials
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: The supplied credentials failed to authenticate againt the specified provider server side

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorExpiredToken
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: For OAuth providers this indicates the access token has expired

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorNoClientConfig
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: No client configuration for the remote scrape service was found server side

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorBadInput
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape worker could not locate all required parameters to initiate scrape (Unexpected)

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorTimeout
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape worker timed out trying to connect to email provider

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorIMAPNoBoxes
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Remote scrape worker connected to IMAP account but found no mailboxes (Unexpected)

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorInvalidReceiptIDs
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Indicates that one or more receipt IDs passed in to a reprocessing job was invalid (will not be returned client side)

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorClientEndpointErrors
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Indicates failure to connect to the results endpoint configured server side (will not be returned client side)

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorJobInProgress
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Could not queue up a remote scrape job because there is already one queued or in progress for this email address

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorIMAPFailedConnection
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Could not connect to or authenticate with the IMAP server

Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BREReceiptRemoteErrorUnknown
Enums/BREReceiptRemoteError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An unknown error was encountered attempting to queue up the remote scrape job

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorNoAccountsLinked
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An attempt was made to grab orders for all merchants or for a specific merchant, but no merchant accounts had been linked

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorAccountLinkedAlready
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An attempt was made to link a merchant, but the same had been linked already

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorVerificationNeeded
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Login encountered a scenario requiring manual user intervention (CAPTCHA, 2FA, etc)

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorVerificationCompleted
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: The user successfully completed the authentication manually

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorNoCredentials
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An attempt was made to grab orders from Amazon (legacy parser) but no Amazon credentials were found

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorInternal
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An unexpected error occurred during login or parsing

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorParsingFail
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: The structure of the merchant’s website or data feed that was encountered during parsing was unexpected

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorInvalidCredentials
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: Login failed on the merchant’s site due to invalid credentials

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorRetailerNotFound
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: An attempt was made to grab orders for a particular merchant but no linked account for that merchant was found

Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.name: BRAccountLinkingErrorFeatureNotAvailable
Enums/BRAccountLinkingError.html#/c:@E@B.abstract: The feature is not available on your device

Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -initWithProvider:email:password:
Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: The first step in linking a user’s IMAP account is instantiating this class with the user’s credentials.

Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.name: -configureCustomHost:port:useTLS:
Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html#/c:objc(cs)BR.abstract: If the IMAP provider is not Gmail, AOL, or Yahoo, use this method to specify the provider’s configuration

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: googleClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Gmail accounts, you must enable the Gmail API in your Google API Console and obtain a Client ID for your app’s bundle.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: outlookClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Outlook accounts, you must register your app at the Azure Portal (https://portal.azure.com/) and add a new App Registration. This will generate an Application (client) ID

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: userHasProvider
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Whether there is a stored provider

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: How far back (in days) to search the user’s inbox for e-receipts

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: dateCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: This property is an alternative to dayCutoff which allows you to set a specific date/time that serves as the boundary of how far back to search.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: searchUntilDate
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: This property works in tandem with dateCutoff and allows you to set the later boundary (i.e. until when) for the search period

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: senderWhitelist
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If populated, the keys in this dictionary will be used as the senders to search the user’s inbox for, and the corresponding values will be used as the merchant sender address for parsing purposes

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: aggregateResults
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Controls whether or not to aggregate all emails relating to a given e-receipt order (such as shipping status updates) in the results structure

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: remoteScrapeClientEndpoint
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If set, overrides the client endpoint configured server side to which results will be POSTed following a remote scrape

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: remoteScrapeUserDateCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If set, overrides the default date cutoff for the current user in remote scrapes

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: countryCode
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If the e-receipts being scraped are known to be from a specific country, set this property to the ISO 2 character country code to improve parsing

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: +shared
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: <hr>

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -getLinkedAccounts
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Retrieves all the currently linked accounts

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -beginOAuthForProvider:withViewController:andCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Begins the OAuth process for the given provider (currently only Gmail and Outlook supported). If the completion is called with no error, you may then invoke -[BREReceiptManager getEReceiptsWithCompletion:]

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -setupIMAPForAccount:viewController:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: To connect to Gmail, Yahoo, or AOL accounts via IMAP, the user will have to enable certain account settings. Call this function to start the process

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -linkIMAPAccountWithoutSetup:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If users have already generated an App Password for a Gmail / Yahoo / AOL IMAP account, use this method to link the account

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -verifyImapAccount:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Verifies that stored IMAP credentials are valid

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -getEReceiptsWithCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Attempts to retrieve new (since last check) e-receipts from all linked e-mail accounts. You must have successfully authenticated an OAuth provider, or stored IMAP credentials (and setup IMAP if necessary) prior to calling this method

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -getEReceiptsForAccount:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Same as above method, just for a single linked account

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -startRemoteEReceiptScrapeWithCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Initiates a remote asynchronous scrape for all linked accounts. You must have successfully authenticated an OAuth provider, or stored IMAP credentials (and setup IMAP if necessary) prior to calling this method

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -startRemoteEReceiptScrapeForAccount:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Same as above method, just for a single linked account

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -startRemoteEReceiptScrapeForEmail:andProvider:andEMLFile:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Initiates a remote asynchronous scrape of provided email data (for cases where inbox scraping is done outside of the BlinkEReceipt SDK)

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -parseEReceiptFromSender:rawHTML:completion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: For debugging the parsing of e-receipt HTML

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -signOutWithCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Signs out of all linked email accounts and stored e-receipt info. For OAuth providers this signs out of the provider and invalidates the access token. For IMAP providers this removes stored credentails.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -signOutFromAccount:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Same as above method, just for a single linked account

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -resetEmailsChecked
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Resets emails for all linked email accounts so you don’t need to log out and log in during testing

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -openURL:options:provider:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: A passthrough function to be used in your app delegate’s openURL:options:provider: method

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: +shared
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: <hr>

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Set this property to control how far back in the user’s history to search for orders

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: dateCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: This property is an alternative to dayCutoff which allows you to set a specific date/time that serves as the boundary of how far back to search.

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: returnLatestOrdersOnly
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: When set to YES, the first scrape will attempt to retrieve orders back to the dayCutoff or dateCutoff but all subsequent scrapes will only go as far back as the last scrape date regardless of whether the first scrape completed

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: countryCode
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Set this to a different country to access the correct version of the retailer’s site, if it exists for that country (currently only supports Amazon UK)

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: version
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Returns current version

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: backgroundFetchCompletion
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: A completion handler to receive updates from a background operation when enabled via enableBackgroundFetchWithIdentifier

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -linkAccountWithCredentials:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Link a retailer online account

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -linkRetailerWithConnection:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Link a retailer connection

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -verifyAccountForRetailer:withCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Verify account for a given retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -verifyRetailerWithConnection:withCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Verify connection for a given retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -getLinkedRetailers
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Returns all retailers for which there is a linked account

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -getLinkedRetailerConnection:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Returns a linked account configuration

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -resetHistoryForRetailer:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Resets order history for a particular retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -resetHistory
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Resets order history for all linked accounts

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -unlinkAccountForRetailer:withCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Unlink a retailer online account

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -unlinkAllAccountsWithCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Unlink all accounts

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -grabNewOrdersWithCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Grab new orders across all linked accounts

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -grabNewOrdersForRetailer:withCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Same as above except allows you to grab orders only for a single retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -cancelConnection:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: It cancels any connection that matches provided identifier

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -updateConnection:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Updates linked connection with latest configuration

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -enableBackgroundFetchWithIdentifier:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: It enables the SDK to check for new orders of all linked retailers periodically in backgorund, If background fetch is enabled by the host app

Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.name: +nameForRetailer:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.abstract: Retrieves a friendly name for a given retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.abstract: Set this property to control how far back in the user’s history to search for orders

Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.name: dateCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.abstract: This property is an alternative to dayCutoff which allows you to set a specific date/time that serves as the boundary of how far back to search.

Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.name: returnLatestOrdersOnly
Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.abstract: When set to YES, the first scrape will attempt to retrieve orders back to the dayCutoff or dateCutoff but all subsequent scrapes will only go as far back as the last scrape date regardless of whether the first scrape completed

Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.name: countryCode
Classes/BRAccountLinkingConfiguration.ht.abstract: Set this to a different country to access the correct version of the retailer’s site, if it exists for that country (currently only supports Amazon UK)

Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.name: BRAccountLinkingCredentials
Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.abstract: Instantiate a BRAccountLinkingCredentials object after collecting the credentials for a given retailer from the user

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html.name: BRAccountLinkingManager
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html.abstract: Use this interface to manage users’ linked retailer accounts for parsing e-receipts. Here is the basic flow:

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html.name: BREReceiptManager
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html.abstract: This class is the interface to manage e-receipt parsing

Classes/BREmailAccount.html.name: BREmailAccount
Classes/BREmailAccount.html.abstract: This class represents a user email account

Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html.name: BRIMAPAccount
Classes/BRIMAPAccount.html.abstract: This class represents an IMAP account that should be instantiated with the user’s credentials prior to beginning IMAP setup in BREReceiptManager
